com.itko.lisa.editor

Class CustomEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.itko.util.swing.panels.ScrollableJPanel
              • com.itko.lisa.editor.CustomEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.itko.lisa.gui.Zoomable, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CustJavaNodeEditor, CustomCompanionEditor, CustomResultEditor

    public abstract class CustomEditor
extends com.itko.util.swing.panels.ScrollableJPanel
implements com.itko.lisa.gui.Zoomable
    This is the heart of how you extend Lisa for your own Test components. To create a custom node editor, you will implement a sublcass of this class or an existing subclass.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

      • getController

        public Controller getController()
        Some times we forget and ask you for the controller back
        Returns:
        the controller associated with this editor

      • isEditorValid

        public abstract java.lang.String isEditorValid()
        When this method is called on your class, validate your editor's contents, and if there is an error, return it as a String object so that the Editor can dispaly it and prevent save/continue. If there is no error, return null
        Returns:
        an error String or null

      • isEditorCompact

        public boolean isEditorCompact()
        The framework uses this method to determine whether the editor for this controller is designed to fit in the narrow inspector (true) or if it requires more real estate (false). At this level, we return false. If a subclass uses a small enough editor, they should override this and return true.
        Returns:
        true if the controller's editor will fit in the model editor object inspector or false if not.

      • haveOverrideMaxInitialTrayWidth

        public boolean haveOverrideMaxInitialTrayWidth()
        Are we overriding the default width?
        Returns:

      • setOverrideMaxInitialTrayWidth

        public void setOverrideMaxInitialTrayWidth(double overrideWidth)
        Override the default tray width. This can be by direct pixels or by percent increase.
        Parameters:
        overrideWidth - 0.0 to 1.0 for percents. Integers for pixels

      • getOverrideMaxInitialTrayWidth

        public int getOverrideMaxInitialTrayWidth()
        What is our width in pixels?
        Returns:

      • display

        public abstract void display()
        Called to refresh whatever you've got in state to the screen. Never trust local state, er, never even keep local state! Always refresh from the controller.

      • save

        public abstract void save()
        When the user wants to save the current editor state back to the underlying object. You do this yourself. You can assume that isEdtiorValid() has just returned null.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Called when we are no longer needed (when used in the UI). Please release listeners that are notorious for Swing memory leaks.

      • aboutToZoom

        public void aboutToZoom()
        A default implementation -- developer can override This method is called just before you get zoomed. This allows the developer to freeze some state if needed since we are about to pop you out of your normal container.
        Specified by:
        aboutToZoom in interface com.itko.lisa.gui.Zoomable

      • finishedZoom

        public void finishedZoom()
        * A default implementation -- developer can override This method is called so you can put yourself back and repaint your UI properly
        Specified by:
        finishedZoom in interface com.itko.lisa.gui.Zoomable

      • exportAssets

        public void exportAssets()
